subject: Running test cases in eclipse at runtime workbench
msgSnippet: hi all, Am generating test cases for Java files with some sample input and expecting the output. i have created classes which extends Test Case class, in turn
messageBody:
hi all,

Am generating test cases for Java files with some sample input and
expecting the output.

i have created classes which extends Test Case class, in turn i have
created necessary stubs in it.

how can i run those test case class through interface at the
click of a button at the runtime workbench....

to my knowledge i have learnt to run test cases in the Eclipse IDE
by right clicking the class name...
i.e Run>JUnit test.....

sample code:

class Box extends TestCase
{
....
...
..}
Box box=new Box();

I've created objects for this Box class in another class and had
given the line
'box.run()' ........

But it doesnt work ,am i correct... if not i beg your pardon.....

Can you provide me some sample code to execute test cases so that i
will be helpful in continuing my project....

thanks in advance....
